project.teaser: Energy efficiency, Renewable Energy Sources, Energy Storage/Batteries, Hydrogen, Efficient Buildings, climate neutrality, reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and decarbonization of industries & coal regions are in the heart of European Policies for the new programming period...
project.objective: Energy efficiency, Renewable Energy Sources, Energy Storage/Batteries, Hydrogen, Efficient Buildings, climate neutrality, reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and decarbonization of industries & coal regions are in the heart of European Policies for the new programming period (ie. Green Deal, EU Strategic Energy Technology Plan, Twin Industrial Transition etc.). Many financial instruments have been setup to support these objectives that have a common denominator in sustainable energy. EU alliances across the value chains (ie. EBA), IPCEIs (ie. Descarbonization & Hydrogen, Batteries) and Research & Policy Platforms (ie. Coal Regions in Transition), are dedicated to facilitate the advancement of R&I in the field through the collective effort of EU members, and enable the transformation of EU regions to climate neutral, thriving economies. This context finds a lot of countries striving to comply, especially challenging those that traditionally have economies heavily dependent on fossil fuel mining and exploitation; a major shift has to be done in a short amount of time, putting at risk the balances in the local economies and making years-long expertise and well-established skills become obsolete. COALition intends to strengthen the regional innovation ecosystems in coal-depended areas through the creation of regional excellence hubs and the definition of a joint strategic agenda for sustainable energy so as to facilitate their transition in a just and inclusive way. The regions have been carefully selected (Western Macedonia - GR, Centru - RO, Southeastern - BG) among the under transition EU states that are also characterized as widening, in an attempt to maximize the long-term impact of the joint R&I strategy that will be developed within the project, as those territories are about to amass large amounts of funding and COALition aims to create multiplier effects in the given investments by attracting and mobilizing external investments.
project.title: Promoting Innovation Excellence in Transformation of Coal Regions to Climate-Neutral, Thriving Economies
project.keywords: Sustainable Energy, R&I Strategy, Coal Regions, Just Transition, Regional Innovation Ecosystems, Excellence Hubs, Joint Action & Investment Plan, Capacity Building, Sustainability, Systemic Solutions

article.title: Regional excellence hubs to facilitate decarbonisation transition

result.title: 1 Collective Life Cycle Assessment Report
result.description: Report on a life cycle assessment to determine the environmental impacts (resource use, human health, and ecological consequences etc.) associated with all the stages of the life cycle of the 3 R&I solutions matured.

result.title: Planning Resources by Model Predictive Control

details.authors: Krasimira Stoilova, Todor Stoilov, Galia Angelova
details.journalTitle: The 14th International Scientific Conference TechSys 2025&mdash;Engineering, Technologies and Systems

result.title: Plan for the Exploitation and Dissemination of Results (PEDR) including communication activities
result.description: The plan will define: the objectives, corresponding measures, target groups, relevant channels & tools to be utilized, visual identity of the project, time schedule & resources for the planned actions and will also set out the KPIs to measure the success of the planned actions and align them with the impact foreseen by the project, along with mitigation measures for any risk foreseen.

result.title: 1 Comparative Analysis Report of Regional Contexts (M6)
result.description: Report on analyses of R&I national strategies & policies, RIS3, EDP results & identification of gaps & opportunities per region. As a result a comparative analysis of regional contexts will be produced by the task leader, to identify the joint areas for definition of the draft joint R&I strategy.

result.title: Non-Conventional Renewable Energy Potential for Improving Electricity Availability for the Residential Area of the Future

details.authors: Cristian-Dragos Dumitru, Adrian Gligor, Daniel-Stanciu Dragomir, Ilie Vlasa
details.journalTitle: 2024 IEEE International Conference And Exposition On Electric And Power Engineering (EPEi)

result.title: 3 Reports on R&I projects matured
result.description: "3 Reports on the research on each of the selected R&I projects (D2.1). All academic and business partners will participate in all 3 projects to jointly implement them. At the end of the task, they will report the research activities performed and the results achieved. #1 report per project."

result.title: 1 Report on Criteria Utilized & 3 R&I Projects Selected
result.description: Report specifying the 3 R&I projects that will be prioritized for implementation, including criteria to be developed such as the level of maturity of the proposed solutions, the significance of the solutions for the areas concerned, the known/existing barriers associated with the solution to be tackled etc

result.title: 3 Scientific Publications
result.description: 3 scientific publications are foreseen, based on the way the results of the R&I projects affect & feed the design of the joint R&I strategy and support the further definition of the action plan.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - COALition (Promoting Innovation Excellence in Transformation of Coal Regions to Climate-Neutral, Thriving Economies)
result.teaser: The COALition project operates within the broader context of the European Union's (EU) commitment to achieving a sustainable energy transition, particularly focusing on regions historically dependent on coal (Western Macedonia - GR, Centru - RO, Southeastern – BG). The...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: 2 Ecosystem Building Workshops’ Minutes
result.description: Report on workshops to train PPs on how to set up and manage the regional R&I ecosystems / excellence hubs, in the form of virtual workshops to be provided by the task leader partner.

result.title: 1 Report with Results and Courses Developed
result.description: Report in form of a survey regarding the active labour market & focus groups to define the needed skills, with emphasis on the unemployed in the labour market, the employees & self-employed whose job is affected by the transition, plus youth & vulnerable communities. The results will be used to develop the content for the workshops in WP5 & the courses will be uploaded in the platform (WP7).

details.authors: K. Stoilova; T. Stoilov; G. Angelova; R. Petrov; I. Klisurov

category.title: coal
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/energy and fuels/fossil energy/coal

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
